intro: Stemonoporus distichus, commonly known as the two-ranked fern, is a species of fern characterized by its unique leaf arrangement. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plant features bipinnate leaves that are arranged in two rows, giving it its common name. Its fronds are typically slender and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Stemonoporus distichus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
